author: slawek
title: Multilingual Communication Centre
description: Ausencia de una comunicación global coherente sobre cuestiones esenciales para el progreso de la red Cardano

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has very little to do with legislation. The correct challenge for this would be 'Multilingual Resources'. It is not specified in the proposal what type of communications center is meant. What is unclear is why there should be new entities in place when there are already multiple means of communications. This proposal lays a heavy focus on multilinguality, but the lobbying sector is already inherently multilingual as they frequently need to communicate with people from different nations. The proposal needs to explain this more.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is claiming to have relevant experience and has marked in the checklist that there is identifying information of the proposers included, but there is no way to confirm this by the information provided in the proposal. There is no explanation of how the requested funds is intended to be used. Specifying this would improve the proposal's feasibility. There has been made good use of the seek-tags, indicating that the proposer is looking for translators and writers to assemble a team.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan gives a rather vague impression as there is no specification. This proposal needs some work to bring it up to standard. It needs a roadmap explaining what is intended to be built along with the time each phase will take and what part of the budget is allocated to it so progress can be tracked. You already have the idea, now it needs to be molded into a proposal. If you need guidance, consider reaching out to proposal mentors for help.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal would perhaps work better if it were split into 2 parts, as it stands now it is too big and generalised. Having a centralised, international organisation coordinating the translation of blockchain related projects would be one of the projects and the other would be a centralised organisation that would lobby politicians all-over the world for better legislation for blockchain and crypto currency. This second one, if it were described in more detail, like how and why it would work better than the current system, then that would fit well into the challenge parameters.
f6_assessments.q1: As mentioned above, the proposal is too big and too broad. It doesn't contain any information regarding the countries the project would be implemented in or the time it would start being operational. There is no estimation of how many people would be needed to start this project, especially for a low budget of $20000, how will this centralised entity be set in motion? Will there be an office, how will people get paid and with how much? There are no answers to these questions, and to many others, as such, I cannot assess its successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: For such a great undertaking, the proposal particulars need to be taken very seriously. There should be more details regarding staff, budget, implementation, potential risks, KPIs and launch date. Without these, it cannot be properly evaluated.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal generally matches the idea behind this part of Catalyst Fund. However, the description is really short and the idea seems to be very early in its development phase. I wish the proposer focused more on smaller picture as at the current state it seems it is very broad and therefore may be hard to reach. 
It would be good to know if the idea behind this proposal is to focus on translations, creating content and then translating or distributing translating content to people who has influence.
f6_assessments.q1: Experience of the team is not documented. It would be good to include real names, experience confirmed with links. There is no roadmap and no detailed budget so I am not sure if this part of proposal is done properly.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no mention on how we could assess the results of this project. I guess existance of this Communication Centre and amount of languages included could be the deciding factor. I suggest mentioning what does the proposer want to start with, how expand in next phases etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
"The applications of blockchain are an inevitable part of global development. But the problem of applying it in life is a dilemma with legal barriers. The idea of creating a data center to hold blockchain information and applications is a good way to make blockchain information transparent to policy makers in countries. Since many countries still don't understand blockchain well, overcoming regulatory hurdles is a problem.
But I still haven't seen a specific solution for the team to turn this idea into a real product"
f6_assessments.q1:
"The proposal has experience in Coordination of large translation/interpretation projects, interpretation at the highest political level, lobbying experience. This is the right experience to create local materials in language and expression. Can make data and documents accessible in a more local way. But I would like to see some evidence for these experiences of proposers like linkedin, twitter, Telegram,.....
Besides, a specific plan and roadmap is essential for the proposal to be feasible"
f6_assessments.q2: As the proposal does not actually set out any clear deliverables, it is not possible to audit the progress or success. Please propose an actual timeline with deliverables and provide some metrics on the produced audits which would define the success of this proposal

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about creating a multilingual comms center (with an extensive database of media and political contacts), a network of translators and creative writers. This is great idea, but it seems that this proposal is incomplete. I agree with most of the arguments provided [especially "the idea of establishing a single entity in charge of the preparation and dissemination of vital information on the benefits of blockchain technology"]. In theory, I think this idea has a certain fit for the challenge. In case this proposal needs to be completed in the future, the proposer should pay attention to because of various legal as well as the cultural context of each country, a single entity may face a risk of conflicts in strategy and action plan ?. Based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's impact and would give it 3 points.
f6_assessments.q1:
Relevant experience section shows that the proposer has experience in coordinating of large translation/interpretation projects, interpretation at the highest political level, lobbying experience, however, there is no proof to prove that.
I am convinced by the problem statement, the solution's idea, which can provide some proof of feasibility for this idea. However, transforming an idea into reality, a detailed plan is required [I am not convinced by an empty plan]. In other words, I can see some proof of feasibility in the idea, not in the plan. Therefore, definitely, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility and would give it 2 points.
f6_assessments.q2: Since this proposal is incomplete, auditability can not be guaranteed. Therefore, I don't have much advice, except that: the proposer needs to pay attention to the principle: judgment, information must be correctly associated with evidence and documents. I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability and would give it 1 points.

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea. I think the team needs to outline and detail the idea in a well-drafted proposal
f6_assessments.q1: This is possible to achieve however, the outcomes and KPIs for the project should be stated specifically. The road map of activities to building a global network of translators should be included in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget should be detailed and given a breakdown of activities of which fund is needed. The proposal should also consider the documentation of activities for easy auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal currently does not address a specific method for making political advocacy. Instead it suggests creating an organisation to coordinate information distribution, similar to the Cardano Foundation that already exists.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no verifiable information about the people who will complete the work outlined in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no breakdown of how the requested funds will be spent. Also there are no details about how the funding would be monitored for progress.

solution: Un centro de comunicación multilingüe con una amplia base de datos de contactos políticos y de medios de comunicación. Red de traductores y redactores creativos.
experience: Coordinación de grandes proyectos de traducción/interpretación, interpretación al más alto nivel político, experiencia en grupos de presión
